data.title: Here Are the 2022 Grammy Award Winners
data.meta_description: Here are the winners of the 2022 Grammy Awards, announced live from Las Vegas on April 3, hosted by Trevor Noah. Jon Batiste leads with five wins out of his 11 including Album of the Year and Silk Sonic went four for four for “Leave the Door Open.”
data.text:
Time to take a break from waiting on albums from Harry Styles, Normani, and even Sky Ferreira and focus on music you loved last year. The 64th annual Grammy Awards are here to honor songs and projects of 2021, like Doja Cat’s Planet Her, Lil Nas X’s Montero, and, of course, Olivia Rodrigo’s Sour. Both Kanye West and Taylor Swift are up for Album of the Year, for Donda and evermore respectively. However, the man of the night is Jon Batiste, the artist who brings you the dulcet tones on Late Show With Stephen Colbert, with the most chances to win this year. The Grammys are hosted by Daily Show’s Trevor Noah at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas. Whoever wins, at least we got a Lady Gaga performance.

Album of the Year

We Are, Jon Batiste

Love For Sale, Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga

Justice (Triple Chucks Deluxe), Justin Bieber

Planet Her (Deluxe), Doja Cat

Happier Than Ever, Billie Eilish

Back of My Mind, H.E.R.

Montero, Lil Nas X

Sour, Olivia Rodrigo

evermore, Taylor Swift

Donda, Kanye West

“Freedom,” Jon Batiste

“I Get a Kick Out of You,” Tony Bennett, and Lady Gaga

“Peaches,” Justin Bieber feat. Daniel Ceasar, and Giveon

“Kiss Me More,” Doja Cat feat. SZA
